page.title: 09INDUSTRY IN WEST CAMBS.
page.content:
Not surprisingly, the small amount of industry in the area has close links with agriculture. A mill, near the old Kimbolton railway station, processes straw to make cattle food, but, in spite of the intensity of arable farming in the district, most of the straw is brought considerable distances by lorry.
Less than a kilometre away, at Blackwell Manor Farm, there is a newly-opened food-mobile depot. These one-man-operated lorries travel round to farms, where they mill the farmers' own grain and mix it with concentrates to produce animal food. Ten men are employed at the depot, all of them from outside the area.
